mainEvents.title: Creation
mainEvents.text: In the beginning God created the heavens and the earth.

mainEvents.title: The Fall
mainEvents.text: She took some and ate it. She also gave some to her husband, who was with her, and he ate it.

mainEvents.title: The Flood
mainEvents.text: For forty days the flood kept coming on the earth.

mainEvents.title: God's Covenant with Abraham
mainEvents.text: I will make you into a great nation and I will bless you.

mainEvents.title: Joseph in Egypt
mainEvents.text: You intended to harm me, but God intended it for good.

mainEvents.title: Nehemiah Rebuilds Jerusalem's Walls
mainEvents.text: Come, let us rebuild the wall of Jerusalem, and we will no longer be in disgrace.

mainEvents.title: Reading of the Law
mainEvents.text: They read from the Book of the Law of God, making it clear and giving the meaning.

mainEvents.title: Dedication of the Wall
mainEvents.text: The sound of rejoicing in Jerusalem could be heard far away.

mainEvents.title: Esther Becomes Queen
mainEvents.text: Now the king was attracted to Esther more than to any of the other women.

mainEvents.title: Haman's Plot
mainEvents.text: Haman looked for a way to destroy all Mordecai's people, the Jews.

mainEvents.title: Esther Saves Her People
mainEvents.text: Grant me my life—this is my petition. And spare my people—this is my request.

mainEvents.title: Job's Suffering
mainEvents.text: The LORD gave and the LORD has taken away; may the name of the LORD be praised.

mainEvents.title: Job's Friends' Counsel
mainEvents.text: They set out from their homes and met together by agreement to go and sympathize with him and comfort him.

mainEvents.title: God Speaks to Job
mainEvents.text: Then the LORD spoke to Job out of the storm.

mainEvents.title: Job's Restoration
mainEvents.text: After Job had prayed for his friends, the LORD restored his fortunes and gave him twice as much as he had before.

mainEvents.title: Psalm of Praise
mainEvents.text: The LORD is my shepherd, I shall not want.

mainEvents.title: Psalm of Repentance
mainEvents.text: Create in me a pure heart, O God, and renew a steadfast spirit within me.

mainEvents.title: Psalm of Thanksgiving
mainEvents.text: Enter his gates with thanksgiving and his courts with praise.

mainEvents.title: The Beginning of Wisdom
mainEvents.text: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge.

mainEvents.title: Trust in the LORD
mainEvents.text: Trust in the LORD with all your heart and lean not on your own understanding.

mainEvents.title: A Virtuous Woman
mainEvents.text: A wife of noble character who can find? She is worth far more than rubies.

mainEvents.title: Everything is Meaningless
mainEvents.text: Meaningless! Meaningless! says the Teacher. Utterly meaningless! Everything is meaningless.

mainEvents.title: A Time for Everything
mainEvents.text: There is a time for everything, and a season for every activity under the heavens.

mainEvents.title: Remember Your Creator
mainEvents.text: Remember your Creator in the days of your youth.

mainEvents.title: The Bride and Bridegroom
mainEvents.text: My beloved is mine and I am his.

mainEvents.title: Love's Strength
mainEvents.text: Love is as strong as death, its jealousy unyielding as the grave.

mainEvents.title: Isaiah's Vision
mainEvents.text: I saw the Lord, high and exalted, seated on a throne.

mainEvents.title: Prophecy of the Messiah
mainEvents.text: For to us a child is born, to us a son is given.

mainEvents.title: Suffering Servant
mainEvents.text: He was pierced for our transgressions, he was crushed for our iniquities.

mainEvents.title: Jeremiah's Call
mainEvents.text: Before I formed you in the womb I knew you, before you were born I set you apart.

mainEvents.title: Prophecy of the New Covenant
mainEvents.text: I will make a new covenant with the people of Israel and with the people of Judah.

mainEvents.title: Fall of Jerusalem
mainEvents.text: On the ninth day of the fourth month of Zedekiah's eleventh year, the city wall was broken through.

mainEvents.title: Jerusalem's Destruction
mainEvents.text: How deserted lies the city, once so full of people!

mainEvents.title: Great Is Your Faithfulness
mainEvents.text: Great is your faithfulness.

mainEvents.title: Vision of the Valley of Dry Bones
mainEvents.text: I will make breath enter you, and you will come to life.

mainEvents.title: Vision of God's Glory
mainEvents.text: This was the appearance of the likeness of the glory of the LORD.

mainEvents.title: Prophecy Against Gog
mainEvents.text: Son of man, set your face against Gog of the land of Magog.

mainEvents.title: Daniel in the Lion's Den
mainEvents.text: My God sent his angel, and he shut the mouths of the lions.

mainEvents.title: Fiery Furnace
mainEvents.text: I see four men walking around in the fire, unbound and unharmed.

mainEvents.title: Nebuchadnezzar's Dream
mainEvents.text: The mystery was revealed to Daniel in a vision.

mainEvents.title: Hosea's Marriage to Gomer
mainEvents.text: Go, marry a promiscuous woman and have children with her.

mainEvents.title: God's Love for Israel
mainEvents.text: I led them with cords of human kindness, with ties of love.

mainEvents.title: The Locust Plague
mainEvents.text: What the locust swarm has left the great locusts have eaten.

mainEvents.title: Promise of the Spirit
mainEvents.text: I will pour out my Spirit on all people.

mainEvents.title: Judgment on Israel
mainEvents.text: Therefore I will send you into exile beyond Damascus.

mainEvents.title: Vision of the Plumb Line
mainEvents.text: I am setting a plumb line among my people Israel.

mainEvents.title: Prophecy Against Edom
mainEvents.text: We have heard a message from the LORD: An envoy was sent to the nations to say, 'Rise, let us go against her for battle.'

mainEvents.title: Restoration of Israel
mainEvents.text: But on Mount Zion will be deliverance; it will be holy, and Jacob will possess his inheritance.

mainEvents.title: Jonah Flees from God
mainEvents.text: But Jonah ran away from the LORD and headed for Tarshish.

mainEvents.title: Jonah in the Fish
mainEvents.text: From inside the fish Jonah prayed to the LORD his God.

mainEvents.title: Nineveh Repents
mainEvents.text: The Ninevites believed God. A fast was proclaimed, and all of them, from the greatest to the least, put on sackcloth.

mainEvents.title: Prophecy of Bethlehem
mainEvents.text: But you, Bethlehem Ephrathah, though you are small among the clans of Judah, out of you will come for me one who will be ruler over Israel.

mainEvents.title: Call for Justice
mainEvents.text: He has shown you, O mortal, what is good. And what does the LORD require of you? To act justly and to love mercy and to walk humbly with your God.

mainEvents.title: Prophecy Against Nineveh
mainEvents.text: A prophecy concerning Nineveh. The book of the vision of Nahum the Elkoshite.

mainEvents.title: Fall of Nineveh
mainEvents.text: All who hear the news about you clap their hands at your fall.

mainEvents.title: Habakkuk's Complaint
mainEvents.text: How long, LORD, must I call for help, but you do not listen?

mainEvents.title: The Righteous Will Live by Faith
mainEvents.text: But the righteous person will live by his faithfulness.

mainEvents.title: The Day of the LORD
mainEvents.text: The great day of the LORD is near—near and coming quickly.

mainEvents.title: Promise to the Remnant
mainEvents.text: The LORD your God is with you, the Mighty Warrior who saves.

mainEvents.title: Call to Rebuild the Temple
mainEvents.text: Go up into the mountains and bring down timber and build my house.

mainEvents.title: Future Glory of the Temple
mainEvents.text: The glory of this present house will be greater than the glory of the former house.

mainEvents.title: Vision of the Horses
mainEvents.text: I saw a man riding a red horse!

mainEvents.title: The Branch
mainEvents.text: Here is the man whose name is the Branch, and he will branch out from his place and build the temple of the LORD.

mainEvents.title: Prophecy of the King
mainEvents.text: See, your king comes to you, righteous and victorious, lowly and riding on a donkey.

mainEvents.title: The Messenger of the Covenant
mainEvents.text: I will send my messenger, who will prepare the way before me.

mainEvents.title: Promise of Elijah
mainEvents.text: See, I will send the prophet Elijah to you before that great and dreadful day of the LORD comes.

mainEvents.title: Passover
mainEvents.text: The first Passover and deliverance from Egypt.

mainEvents.title: Crossing the Red Sea
mainEvents.text: Israelites cross the Red Sea and escape Pharaoh.

mainEvents.title: Ten Commandments
mainEvents.text: The Ten Commandments given at Sinai.

mainEvents.title: Laws of Sacrifice
mainEvents.text: When any of you brings an offering to the LORD...

mainEvents.title: Day of Atonement
mainEvents.text: On this day atonement will be made for you, to cleanse you.

mainEvents.title: Laws of Holiness
mainEvents.text: Be holy, for I the LORD your God am holy.

mainEvents.title: Census of Israel
mainEvents.text: Take a census of the whole Israelite community.

mainEvents.title: Spies Sent to Canaan
mainEvents.text: Send some men to explore the land of Canaan.

mainEvents.title: Balaam's Donkey
mainEvents.text: Then the LORD opened the donkey's mouth...

mainEvents.title: Aaron's Death
mainEvents.text: Aaron died there on the top of the mountain.

mainEvents.title: Moses' Final Address
mainEvents.text: Hear, O Israel: The LORD our God, the LORD is one. Love the LORD your God...

mainEvents.title: The Shema
mainEvents.text: Hear, O Israel: The LORD our God, the LORD is one.

mainEvents.title: Blessings and Curses
mainEvents.text: All these blessings will come on you and accompany you if you obey the LORD your God.

mainEvents.title: Death of Moses
mainEvents.text: And Moses the servant of the LORD died there in Moab.

mainEvents.title: Crossing the Jordan
mainEvents.text: The priests who carried the ark of the covenant of the LORD stood firm on dry ground in the middle of the Jordan.

mainEvents.title: Fall of Jericho
mainEvents.text: When the trumpets sounded, the wall collapsed; so every man charged straight in, and they took the city.

mainEvents.title: Sun Stands Still
mainEvents.text: So the sun stood still, and the moon stopped, till the nation avenged itself on its enemies.

mainEvents.title: Deborah Leads Israel
mainEvents.text: Deborah, a prophetess, was leading Israel at that time.

mainEvents.title: Gideon's Victory
mainEvents.text: They blew their trumpets and broke the jars... and the Midianite army fled.

mainEvents.title: Samson and Delilah
mainEvents.text: Samson said, 'Let me die with the Philistines!' Then he pushed with all his might, and the temple fell.

mainEvents.title: Ruth's Loyalty
mainEvents.text: Where you go I will go, and where you stay I will stay. Your people will be my people and your God my God.

mainEvents.title: Ruth Meets Boaz
mainEvents.text: May the LORD repay you for what you have done.

mainEvents.title: Ruth Marries Boaz
mainEvents.text: So Boaz took Ruth and she became his wife.

mainEvents.title: Hannah's Prayer
mainEvents.text: I prayed for this child, and the LORD has granted me what I asked of him.

mainEvents.title: Samuel Hears God
mainEvents.text: The LORD came and stood there, calling as at the other times, 'Samuel! Samuel!'

mainEvents.title: Saul Anointed King
mainEvents.text: Samuel took a flask of oil and poured it on Saul's head and kissed him, saying, 'Has not the LORD anointed you ruler over his inheritance?'

mainEvents.title: David and Goliath
mainEvents.text: So David triumphed over the Philistine with a sling and a stone.

mainEvents.title: David Becomes King
mainEvents.text: They anointed David king over Israel.

mainEvents.title: David Brings the Ark to Jerusalem
mainEvents.text: David, wearing a linen ephod, danced before the LORD with all his might.

mainEvents.title: God's Covenant with David
mainEvents.text: Your house and your kingdom will endure forever before me; your throne will be established forever.

mainEvents.title: Bathsheba and Uriah
mainEvents.text: Put Uriah out in front where the fighting is fiercest.

mainEvents.title: Absalom's Rebellion
mainEvents.text: Absalom sent secret messengers throughout the tribes of Israel to say, 'As soon as you hear the sound of the trumpets, then say, Absalom is king in Hebron.'

mainEvents.title: David Becomes King
mainEvents.text: They anointed David king over Israel.

mainEvents.title: David Brings the Ark to Jerusalem
mainEvents.text: David, wearing a linen ephod, danced before the LORD with all his might.

mainEvents.title: God's Covenant with David
mainEvents.text: Your house and your kingdom will endure forever before me; your throne will be established forever.

mainEvents.title: Bathsheba and Uriah
mainEvents.text: Put Uriah out in front where the fighting is fiercest.

mainEvents.title: Absalom's Rebellion
mainEvents.text: Absalom sent secret messengers throughout the tribes of Israel to say, 'As soon as you hear the sound of the trumpets, then say, Absalom is king in Hebron.'

mainEvents.title: Solomon Becomes King
mainEvents.text: So Solomon sat on the throne of his father David, and his rule was firmly established.

mainEvents.title: Solomon Builds the Temple
mainEvents.text: In the four hundred and eightieth year after the Israelites came out of Egypt... Solomon began to build the temple of the LORD.

mainEvents.title: Division of the Kingdom
mainEvents.text: All Israel made Jeroboam king over all Israel.

mainEvents.title: Elijah and the Prophets of Baal
mainEvents.text: Then the fire of the LORD fell and burned up the sacrifice.

mainEvents.title: Elisha Succeeds Elijah
mainEvents.text: Elijah went up to heaven in a whirlwind.

mainEvents.title: Hezekiah's Prayer
mainEvents.text: Hezekiah prayed to the LORD: 'O LORD, God of Israel... you alone are God.'

mainEvents.title: Josiah's Reform
mainEvents.text: Neither before nor after Josiah was there a king like him who turned to the LORD as he did.

mainEvents.title: Fall of Jerusalem
mainEvents.text: He set fire to the temple of the LORD, the royal palace and all the houses of Jerusalem.

mainEvents.title: Genealogies of Israel
mainEvents.text: Adam, Seth, Enosh...

mainEvents.title: David Brings the Ark to Jerusalem
mainEvents.text: So all Israel brought up the ark of the covenant of the LORD with shouts.

mainEvents.title: David's Plans for the Temple
mainEvents.text: David said to Solomon: 'My son, I had it in my heart to build a house for the Name of the LORD my God.'

mainEvents.title: Solomon's Temple Dedicated
mainEvents.text: When Solomon finished praying, fire came down from heaven and consumed the burnt offering.

mainEvents.title: Jehoshaphat's Victory
mainEvents.text: As they began to sing and praise, the LORD set ambushes against the men of Ammon and Moab.

mainEvents.title: Reforms of Hezekiah
mainEvents.text: In the first month of the first year of his reign, he opened the doors of the temple of the LORD and repaired them.

mainEvents.title: Fall of Jerusalem
mainEvents.text: They set fire to God's temple and broke down the wall of Jerusalem.

mainEvents.title: Return from Exile
mainEvents.text: Any of his people among you may go up to Jerusalem in Judah and build the temple of the LORD.

mainEvents.title: Rebuilding the Temple
mainEvents.text: With praise and thanksgiving they sang to the LORD: 'He is good; his love toward Israel endures forever.'

mainEvents.title: Ezra Reads the Law
mainEvents.text: Ezra had devoted himself to the study and observance of the Law of the LORD.

mainEvents.title: The Bride and Bridegroom
mainEvents.text: My beloved is mine and I am his.

mainEvents.title: Love's Strength
mainEvents.text: Love is as strong as death, its jealousy unyielding as the grave.
